docs.snippet: Bundesliga top scorer Stefan Kiessling has signed a two-year contract extension with Bayer Leverkusen, keeping him at next season's Champions League competitors until 2017, the club said on Friday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Bundesliga top scorer Stefan Kiessling has signed a two-year contract extension with Bayer Leverkusen, keeping him at next season's Champions League competitors until 2017, the club said on Friday.

headline.main: Top Scorer Kiessling Extends Leverkusen Deal to 2017
headline.print_headline: Top Scorer Kiessling Extends Leverkusen Deal to 2017

docs.snippet: Cuban President Raul Castro assured his people on Friday that a transfer of power to younger generations had begun, in a televised address marking the 60th anniversary of the start of the Cuban revolution.
docs.lead_paragraph: Cuban President Raul Castro assured his people on Friday that a transfer of power to younger generations had begun, in a televised address marking the 60th anniversary of the start of the Cuban revolution.

headline.main: Cuba's Raul Castro Promises Succession Has Started
headline.print_headline: Cuba's Raul Castro Promises Succession Has Started

docs.snippet: Eduardo Galeano’s daybook of political and social struggle.
docs.lead_paragraph: Eduardo Galeano’s daybook of political and social struggle.
docs.abstract: Greg Grandin reviews book Children of the Days: A Calendar of Human History by Eduardo Galeano, translated by Mark Fried.

headline.seo: ‘Children of the Days,’ by Eduardo Galeano

docs.snippet: Pope Francis' historic trip to his home continent ended Sunday after a marathon weeklong visit to Brazil that drew millions of people onto the sands of Rio de Janeiro's iconic Copacabana beach and appeared to reinvigorate the clergy and faithful...
docs.lead_paragraph: Pope Francis' historic trip to his home continent ended Sunday after a marathon weeklong visit to Brazil that drew millions of people onto the sands of Rio de Janeiro's iconic Copacabana beach and appeared to reinvigorate the clergy and faithful alike in the world's largest Catholic country.

headline.main: Pope Draws 3M to Mass as Brazil Trip Closes
headline.print_headline: Pope Draws 3M to Mass as Brazil Trip Closes

docs.snippet: “If someone is gay and he searches for the Lord and has good will, who am I to judge?” Francis was quoted as saying on Monday.
docs.lead_paragraph: “If someone is gay and he searches for the Lord and has good will, who am I to judge?” Francis was quoted as saying on Monday.
docs.abstract: Pope Francis makes brief remarks suggesting that he would not judge priests for their sexual orientation; never veering from church doctrine opposing homosexuality, Francis does strike a more compassionate tone than that of his predecessors, some of whom had largely avoided even saying the more colloquial 'gay.'

headline.main: On Gay Priests, Pope Francis Asks, ‘Who Am I to Judge?’
headline.print_headline: On Gay Priests, Pope Asks, ‘Who Am I to Judge?’

byline.contributor: Simon Romero and Taylor Barnes contributed reporting from Rio de Janeiro.

docs.snippet: Uruguay's unprecedented plan to create a legal marijuana market won its critical first step Wednesday in the lower house of Congress.
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay's unprecedented plan to create a legal marijuana market won its critical first step Wednesday in the lower house of Congress.

headline.main: Uruguay's House OKs Legal Marijuana Market Plan
headline.print_headline: Uruguay's House OKs Legal Marijuana Market Plan

docs.snippet: In recent months, one of SVB Financial Group’s subsidiaries, Silicon Valley Bank, has added venture capital firms and young companies in Brazil as clients. And SVB Capital, another subsidiary, expects to make new investments in South American...
docs.abstract: In recent months, one of SVB Financial Group’s subsidiaries, Silicon Valley Bank, has added venture capital firms and young companies in Brazil as clients. And SVB Capital, another subsidiary, expects to make new investments in South American venture capital firms.

headline.main: U.S. Financial Firm Courts Start-Ups in Brazil

docs.snippet: Legislators approved the bill, opening the way for the authorities to create one of Latin America’s most ambitious nationwide endeavors in overhauling drug policy.
docs.lead_paragraph: Legislators approved the bill, opening the way for the authorities to create one of Latin America’s most ambitious nationwide endeavors in overhauling drug policy.
docs.abstract: Uruguay’s lower house votes 50 to 46 to approve a sweeping bill to legalize marijuana, opening the way for one of Latin America’s most ambitious nationwide endeavors in overhauling drug policy.

headline.main: Lawmakers in Uruguay Vote to Legalize Marijuana
headline.print_headline: Lawmakers in Uruguay Vote to Legalize Marijuana

byline.contributor: Mauricio Rabuffetti contributed reporting from Montevideo, Uruguay.

docs.snippet: Uruguay's leftist President Jose Mujica said his country would not become a haven for pot smokers the day after its lower chamber of Congress narrowly voted to legalize the cultivation and sale of marijuana.
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay's leftist President Jose Mujica said his country would not become a haven for pot smokers the day after its lower chamber of Congress narrowly voted to legalize the cultivation and sale of marijuana.

headline.main: Uruguay President Defends 'Cutting Edge' Pot Legalization Vote
headline.print_headline: Uruguay President Defends 'Cutting Edge' Pot Legalization Vote
